issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

versions.description: Dynamic Reconfig, Remove Watches, Local Session

fields.summary: ZooKeeper Java cli shell always returns "0" as exit code

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> $ZOOKEEPER_HOME/bin/zkCli.sh create /test "test"
Created /test1
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> echo $?
0
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> $ZOOKEEPER_HOME/bin/zkCli.sh create /test "test"
Node already exists: /test1
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> echo $?
0
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> $ZOOKEEPER_HOME/bin/zkCli.sh delete /test
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> echo $?
0
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> $ZOOKEEPER_HOME/bin/zkCli.sh delete /test
Node does not exist: /test1
Linux@hghoulaslx406:/> echo $?
0


Here for failed command it should return exit code 1
fields.summary: Incorrect exit codes for "./zkCli.sh cmd arg"

comments.body: Please assign this Jira to me, I will upload patch soon
I have attached patch , Please review it.
Looks like a duplicate of ZOOKEEPER-1897...
Hi Simon,

I donâ€™t think it is duplicate, In that jira they are not checking command result.
But I want, we should check command result and then do exit with 1 if command result is false.
Please can someone review my patch and assign this issue to me..Thank in advance

Thanks [~surendrasingh] for the patch. Can you move the command result check and {{System.exit(1);}} one level up to the ZooKeeperMain#main() method. I could see {{ZooKeeperMain#run()}} has default access, if someone embedded this in their code then may exit the JVM, right?

Thanks [~rakeshr] .

Yes you are correct , I will change the patch and upload soon..

[~rakeshr]

I have attached new patch, please review it.
Thanks in advance.
+1 lgtm

@Rakesh 

Thanks for review

trunk: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1658307
branch-3.5: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1658308

ABORTED: Integrated in ZooKeeper-trunk #2590 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk/2590/])
ZOOKEEPER-2074 Incorrect exit codes for "./zkCli.sh cmd arg" (surendra singh lilhore via michim) (michim: http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1658307)
* /zookeeper/trunk/CHANGES.txt
* /zookeeper/trunk/src/java/main/org/apache/zookeeper/ZooKeeperMain.java
with this patch even successful commands return 1 if processZKCmd returns false.
[~michim] did you revert the change? Do we want to revert or fix?

Yes, I just reverted the change:

trunk: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1666760
branch-3.5: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1666761

* /zookeeper/trunk/src/java/main/org/apache/zookeeper/ZooKeeperMain.java
Thanks [~michim] for pointing out this case. [~surendrasingh] could you re-look at it.
Attached new patch, please review

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12707442/ZOOKEEPER-2074_3.patch
  against trunk revision 1669062.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed core unit tests.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

I do not believe the test failure is relevant to this patch
That is a known failure taken care of by ZOOKEEPER-2080.

hey [~abrahamfine], this patch is a complement of ZOOKEEPER-1898, right? I am linking the two so that we can expose the relation between the two issues.

LGTM (informal review). :)
[~eribeiro] indeed, they are related. thanks for taking a look!
Looks good - however DEFAULT_EXIT_CODE is really the default error exit code, right? Can you change variable, e.g. DEFAULT_EXIT_CODE_ON_ERROR or something like that?
